enemies.name: Lex Luthor
enemies.description: No Superman villain is as well known, or as well-loved as Lex Luthor. Often seen as the de facto leader of all of the DCU's supervillains

enemies.name: Darkseid
enemies.description: The tyrannical ruler of Apokolips, a sadistic tyrant who has invaded and conquered countless worlds throughout the universe

enemies.name: Zod
enemies.description: Once considered an outstanding military hero of the planet Krypton, Dru-Zod decided he would rather rule his world than serve it

enemies.name: Doomsday
enemies.description: A weapon crafted in the most extreme conditions, Doomsday is an unstoppable force of destruction, devastation and death

enemies.name: Bizarro
enemies.description: As result of a bizarre science experiment, Bizarro is an imperfect duplicate of Kal-El, with none of his intelligence or self-control

enemies.name: Brainiac
enemies.description: One of the most intelligent beings in the entire universe, the wicked Brainiac's genius has challenged Superman over and over again

enemies.name: Parasite
enemies.description: Parasite feeds on energy to live and his touch allows him to sap the powers and memories of his victims, making him a formidable foe

enemies.name: Metallo
enemies.description: Metallo is more of an evil Tony Stark since his metallic body has all the technology needed to perform as well as the most gifted hero

enemies.name: The Joker
enemies.description: The Clown Prince of Crime is the authentic nemesis of Batman. His desire for chaos and carnage makes him a difficult villain to stop

enemies.name: Catwoman
enemies.description: Selina Kyle is a good person who does bad things, making her both a sympathetic villain and an uneasy ally for the caped crusader

enemies.name: Two-face
enemies.description: Former district attorney, he became badly disfigured after a mob boss throws acid on his face. This fact turned him into Two-Face

enemies.name: The Penguin
enemies.description: Despite being the grotesque face of the city's criminal underworld, The Penguin has displayed intelligence and sophistication

enemies.name: The Riddler
enemies.description: At his best, this enigmatic evildoer is a riddling madman hellbent on pitting his amazing wits against the world's greatest detective

enemies.name: Bane
enemies.description: After nearly dying from an experimental super-soldier program, this villain reached the pinnacle of physical and mental skills

enemies.name: Poison Ivy
enemies.description: Poison Ivy is a lethal and beauty eco-terrorist who is obsessed with protecting the planet's plant life by eliminating all human life

enemies.name: Ras Al Ghul
enemies.description: This super-intelligent, mystical international assassin leads the League of Assassins whose main purpose is purging the crimes of humanity

enemies.name: Cheetah
enemies.description: Cheetah may not only be the most famous of all of Wonder Woman's rogue gallery, but also the most lethal since she is the avatar of a god

enemies.name: Ares
enemies.description: The Greek god of war is obviously a very dangerous foe. Ares is constantly lusting for more violence being extremely brutal in battle

enemies.name: Circe
enemies.description: Based on the sorceress of Greek mythology, the Circe of the comics contains much of her mythological traits and powers

enemies.name: Veronica Cale
enemies.description: A scientific genius and uber-rich (as owner of a pharmaceutical company). Cale is to Wonder Woman what Lex Luthor is to Superman

enemies.name: Doctor Psycho
enemies.description: This villain is sadistic and misogynistic. In some ways, he is the polar opposite of everything that Diana actually stands for

enemies.name: Silver Swan
enemies.description: From ugly duckling to murderous cyborg, Silver Swan might just have the most versatile resume of all of Wonder Woman’s enemies

enemies.name: Giganta
enemies.description: A scientist with a fatal blood disease that leads her to try and swap bodies with Diana. She has the power to grow to a huge height

enemies.name: Devastation
enemies.description: Her tragic nature combined with her powers being a dark echo of Diana's results in this foe being one of the more intriguing villains

enemies.name: Reverse Flash
enemies.description: As a dark mirror of the character, he traveled back in time and killed Flash's mother, which is what led Flash to become a hero

enemies.name: Grood
enemies.description: Hailing from Gorilla City, a hidden society of highly evolved apes, Grodd has frequently tried to infiltrate and conquer man's world

enemies.name: Savitar
enemies.description: Named as the Hindu god-of-motion, Savitar was a pilot whose plane was suddenly struck by lightning, giving him super-speed

enemies.name: Captain Cold
enemies.description: This dangerous criminal is not a superpowered villain but instead uses weapons and tech that freezes everything around instantly

enemies.name: The Thinker
enemies.description: With a weaponized chair. The Thinker is the smartest villain on this list and is therefore one step ahead of the hero most of the times

enemies.name: Mirror Master
enemies.description: A lifelong criminal who became in a master of illusion, he makes use of his mirror gun to vex and addle the Scarlet Speedster at every turn

enemies.name: Heatwave
enemies.description: A deadly villain who has committed countless crimes of arson and thieving. Even the fastest man alive can't run from the flames forever

enemies.name: Captain Boomerang
enemies.description: Because of his level of technology and skills with them, he is actually one of the most memorable people on the Flash's foes gallery

enemies.name: Sinestro
enemies.description: A former member of the Green Lantern Corps, Sinestro turns on the Guardians and dons a yellow ring, a ring powered by fear

enemies.name: Parallax
enemies.description: An evil space bug named Parallax who is the embodiment of all fear, it has gone on to possess numerous people across the universe

enemies.name: Nekron
enemies.description: Responsible for instigating the events of Blackest Night, Nekron led to the revival of millions of both, dead heroes and villains

enemies.name: Atrocitus
enemies.description: Survivor of a Manhunter attack. Enraged, Atrocitus gave birth to the Red Lantern Corps and wields his rage like a weapon

enemies.name: larfleeze
enemies.description: Larfleeze is the only member of the Orange Lantern Corps. With an immense amount of power, the agent orange is powered by avarice

enemies.name: Krona
enemies.description: The resulting wave of cosmic power turned Krona into a being of pure energy who became a overly powerful cosmic-level entity

enemies.name: Hector Hammond
enemies.description: Hector Hammond is a metahuman with a very large head whose telepathic abilities have constantly made him a foe to be reckoned with

enemies.name: Doctor Polaris
enemies.description: one minute appearing as Neal Emmerson and the next the dangerous Polaris who uses his powers to control magnetic fields

enemies.name: Black Manta
enemies.description: This villain is the main Aquaman's arch-nemesis. Consumed by his vendetta, he seeks the death of Arthur and the destruction of Atlantis

enemies.name: Ocean Master
enemies.description: The Ocean Master has seen himself as the true and unique king of Atlantis and has butted heads with Arthur on numerous occasions

enemies.name: Trench
enemies.description: A former tribe of Atlantis that mutated to in the depths, the Trench is a huge menace which exists only to feed and kill anything it sees

enemies.name: Dead King
enemies.description: Atlan is an ancient ruler of Atlantis who actually represents all of the worst elements of Atlantean culture. He is racist and elitist

enemies.name: Siren
enemies.description: Considered to be one of the greatest female villains of Aquaman's rogue's gallery, Siren is the sister of Mera and sister-in-law to Arthur

enemies.name: Charybdis
enemies.description: Driven mad when his wife and partner in crime Scylla was killed in an attempt to murder Aquaman, he became a major threat to the hero

enemies.name: Corum Rath
enemies.description: Leader of the eco-terrorist group known as the Deluge, Corum Rath became Atlantis king. This enemy forms a dark mirror to Aquaman

enemies.name: King Shark
enemies.description: Mutant or son of a shark god? he is a super-villain and humanoid shark. Driven by animal instincts, he is unable to stop his need to feed

enemies.name: Anomaly
enemies.description: As a product of experimentation by Silas Stone, the father of Cyborg, he was created to replicate organic tissue to save Silas's wife

enemies.name: H8-Bit
enemies.description: He was a brilliant hacker before becoming in one of the unique villains due to his electricity powers and technology control

enemies.name: Shrapnel
enemies.description: This villain is a walking piece of organic metal with super-strength, endurance, and self-sustainability. An actual threat for any hero

enemies.name: Grid
enemies.description: Grid is a malevolent sentient computer virus that lived within Cyborg’s. It's main goal is to feel the emotions of other living things

enemies.name: Magenta
enemies.description: With a mental illness that gave her a dissociative personality disorder, Magenta also owns powers related to magnetism

enemies.name: Cyborg Girl
enemies.description: Her aunt replaced her body with powerful cybernetic implants. Sadly, those upgrades are not used for the good of humanity at all

enemies.name: Bobby Zirrozinski
enemies.description: A strong hatred for Cyborg, he is a military veteran who underwent a backdoor operation to add cybernetic attachments to his body

enemies.name: Gizmo
enemies.description: This brainy enemy is a highly resourceful chap who is able to create a new machine with almost anything he has access to
